statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 8 \\ 6 \\ 3 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 0 \\ 6 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 18 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 8 \\ 6 \\ 3 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 0 \\ 6 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 18 \end{array}\right].
